actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability.

official_title: Expressing the sense of Congress that Congress, as well as people throughout the Nation, should hold an annual commemorative event on or near August 20th to revere, honor, and remember the victims of slavery in the United States as well as to prevent slavery from ever happening again.
short_title: Original Slavery Remembrance Day Memorialization Resolution
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues
subjects_top_term: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text:
Original Slavery Remembrance Day Memorialization Resolution

This concurrent resolution expresses the sense of Congress that (1) Congress should hold an annual commemorative event at a location in the U.S. Capitol Complex to revere, honor, and remember the victims of slavery; and (2) similar commemorative events should be held throughout the nation.

titles.title: Original Slavery Remembrance Day Memorialization Resolution
Original Slavery Remembrance Day Memorialization Resolution

Expressing the sense of Congress that Congress, as well as people throughout the Nation, should hold an annual commemorative event on or near August 20th to revere, honor, and remember the victims of slavery in the United States as well as to prevent slavery from ever happening again.
